link.synopsis: While musing on how they would prefer to die, six aging friends hatch Operation Bon Voyage au Chocolate: When life is no longer worth living, they'll sail off into the sunset while they eat enough chocolate to literally kill them. The pals periodically reunite on a boat off the North Carolina coast to share their joys, doubts and struggles -- and to determine if the time is ripe to set their plan in motion. Bud Dowdey directs this dark indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home

link.synopsis: When he takes a job in a hospital working under an uncle he holds in high esteem, a young physician comes face to face with illegal activity that makes him question everything -- including his uncle's integrity. All the while, a female social worker is falling for the doctor, but he's blind to her affections. Bharat Jadhav, Vinay Yedekar and Surekha Kudachi head the cast of this rib-tickling comedy directed by Vijay Gokhale (who also stars).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: With his eye on a gangster's girl, Inspector Wong (Pak-cheung Chan) assigns three undercover policemen (Chapman To, Shawn Yue and Chi Chung Lam) to dig up something -- anything -- that will prove the gangster is involved in illegal activities. But what can you do when there's nothing to find? Meanwhile, the gangster in question has his own man working inside the police department. Jing Wong directs this update of his 1987 comedy, The Romancing Star.
link.title: synopsis
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro

title.regular: Love Is a Many Stupid Thing
title.short: Love Is a Many Stupid Thing

link.synopsis: Producer Sam Goldwyn and director Howard Hawks reunited for this star-studded remake of their 1941 comedy Ball of Fire, the story of seven scholars (including Danny Kaye and Benny Goodman) in search of an expert to teach them about swing music. They seem to have found the perfect candidate in winsome nightclub singer Honey Swanson (Virginia Mayo). But Honey's gangster boyfriend doesn't want to give her up.
link.title: synopsis
I Was a Male War Bride
East Side of Heaven / If I Had My Way
All You Need Is Love: The Story of Popular Music
My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
Let's Hear It for the Girls!

link.synopsis: Worried he can't afford his son's college tuition, Roger (Joe Gnoffo) -- a little person -- tries to convince his small-statured friends to enter a basketball tournament in the hopes of winning the $50,000 grand prize. The pals finally agree, but the squad is still one man short. Enter legendary NBA champ Dennis Rodman. With the help of the bad-boy athlete, Roger and company just might take the top prize in this offbeat family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs
Lucy Must Be Traded, Charlie Brown
The Pistol: The Birth of a Legend
Nic and Tristan Go Mega Dega
Better Golf for Kids Vol. 1 with James Pugliese

link.synopsis: After moving into a decrepit house, struggling songwriter Tom (Michael Hampton) finds an unlikely roommate in the form of a live human hand sprouting from his basement floor. As the mysterious growth continues to evolve, so does its relationship with Tom, who's also busy falling in love with his neighbor's girlfriend, Veronica (Devon Iott). Dark comedy, horror and musical numbers intermingle with spine-tingling glee in this warped indie film.
link.title: synopsis
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
The Curse of the Black Dahlia

link.synopsis: It was only yesterday that Michelle was a beautiful baby. Now, she's a beautiful woman engaged to a young man from an upper-class family. But what seems like good news is really an anxiety-inducing disaster for Michelle's father, Jerome. The blue-collar dad can't fathom what life will be like without his little girl -- and it isn't long before the hapless father of the bride starts sabotaging the wedding in this fun, Christian-themed comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right
Pastor Jones 2: Help Save My Daughter
Pastor Jones: My Sister Loves You
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed
The Six Wives of Henry Lefay

title.regular: Keepin' the Faith: My Baby's Gettin' Married!
title.short: Keepin' the Faith: My Baby's Gettin'...

link.synopsis: When the spirit of a powerful warrior takes over the body of kindly post office employee Reggie Carson (Mark Hicks), our unsuspecting hero quickly develops mad ninja skills … and a righteous afro! A corrupt scheme involving politicians, cops and a local kickboxing star soon threatens to destroy the neighborhood, and only Afro Ninja can save the day in this madcap martial arts comedy, also starring Marla Gibbs.
link.title: synopsis
G.I. Joe: The Rise of Cobra
Seventeen Ninja / Hero of Swallow / Ninja Power Force / Ninja Phantom Force
Inglorious Bastards 2: Hell Heroes / Bridge to Hell / Warbus 2 / Apocalypse Mercenaries
The Great Bank Hoax / The Great Bank Robbery
One Down Two to Go / Brotherhood of Death: Double Feature

link.synopsis: Veteran stand-up comedian (and regular on the TV sitcom "Home Improvement") Jim Labriola hosts this comedy bonanza that makes you an offer you can't refuse and otherwise pokes fun at all things Italian-American. To keep the laughs coming fast and furious, fellow comedians and Guidos Vic DiBitetto, Rob Magnotti, Al Romero and Johnny Rizzo also take the stage before a raucous audience in Atlantic City, N.J. You gotta problem with dat?
link.title: synopsis
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Jo Koy: Don't Make Him Angry
Joe Rogan: Talking Monkeys in Space
Gabriel Iglesias: I'm Not Fat ... I'm Fluffy
Rita Rudner: Live from Las Vegas
Brian Regan: The Epitome of Hyperbole
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Donnell Rawlings: From Ashy to Classy
Mike Birbiglia: What I Should Have Said Was Nothing: Tales From My Secret Public Journal
Dane Cook: Rough Around the Edges: Live from Madison Square Garden
Bobby Jones: Comedy All Stars: Vol. 1
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Comics on Duty: We Love You, Mrs. Bevins
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
Nick Kroll: Thank You Very Cool
Larry the Cable Guy: Morning Constitutions
Katt Williams: American Hustle: The Movie
Just for Laughs: Stand-Up: Vol. 2: On the Edge
Penn & Teller: Off the Deep End

title.regular: Jim Labriola's Night of a 1000 Guido's
title.short: Jim Labriola's Night of a 1000 Guido's

link.synopsis: When washed-up downhill skiing pro Jomar Henriksen (Anders Baasmo Christiansen) learns that he has a son he never knew about living up north, he packs a gallon of booze, hops on his snowmobile and lurches off to see his progeny. But his trip is touch-and-go as he runs into other lonesome souls and some surreal obstacles. Will he find his way to his son -- and back to a productive life? Rune Denstad Langlo directs this delightfully offbeat comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Amazing Truth About Queen Raquela
Bab'Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul

link.synopsis: Fascinated by the experiences of the humans they watch over, a group of gods and goddesses takes a leave from Mt. Olympus and descends upon Mexico City, wreaking havoc on the lives of the mortals who cross their paths. Salvador Garcini directs this star-laden comedy that stars Jesus Ochoa (Beverly Hills Chihuahua), Diana Bracho, Lisa Owen (Vantage Point), Luis Roberto Guzman, Pedro Armendariz Jr. (The Legend of Zorro), Kalimba and Blanca Soto.
link.title: synopsis
A Good Death Beats a Dull Life

link.synopsis: After a fateful visit to the planetarium, plucky shop girl Emmy (Irene Hervey) and dashing med student John (Charles Starrett) share a whirlwind romance, but the surprise arrest of Emmy's mother (Irene Franklin) at a burlesque house casts a shadow of scandal on the young lovers. Hilarity ensues in this zany comedy, also starring H.B. Warner as John's mentor, Dr. Martin, and Ferdinand Gottschalk as Emmy's boss, Mr. Vincent.
link.title: synopsis
The Loretta Young Show: Christina's Children Series
Great Wacky Western Comedies: The Wackiest Wagon Train in the West / Fair Play / The Terror of Tiny Town
Adventures in Iraq / The Legion of Missing Men
Ringside: The Best of Mike Tyson
Here Comes Cookie / Love in Bloom / Six of a Kind: Triple Feature
You Can't Take It with You
St. Martin's Lane / Wings of the Morning: Double Feature

link.synopsis: After an appendage-severing mishap with his dad's mincer, young Jono Smith (Ed Kavalee) gets a chance to have his manhood restored when a porn star dies unexpectedly, opening the door for a much-needed transplant. With a little luck and the help of his pals, our hero might just find his wildest sex fantasies fulfilled in this spirited gross-out teen comedy from Australia. Sandy Gutman and John Boxer co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Beer: The Movie 2: Leaving Long Island
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me

link.synopsis: When they come across a copy of The Suicide Club by Robert Louis Stevenson, a group of people frustrated by their failed suicide attempts decide to forgo therapy and get the deed done through a card game: The loser must kill the winner. But the friends soon discover that killing each other is even harder than killing themselves. Fernando Tejero, Lucía Jiménez and Luis Callejo star in this black comedy from director Roberto Santiago.
link.title: synopsis
The Wolf Man / Frankenstein Meets the Wolf Man
El Penalti Mas Largo Del Mundo
R2: Y el Caso del Cadaver Sin Cabeza
The Other Side of the Bed

link.synopsis: Wildly popular British comedy team Dawn French and Jennifer Saunders bring their award-winning brand of quirky humor to the stage in London's West End, delighting a capacity crowd at the historic Shaftesbury Theatre. Combining razor-sharp improvisational wit with fearless, sketch-style spoofs of popular U.K. television shows such as "Casualty" and "Big Brother," the pair proves once again that innovative satire is alive and well.
link.title: synopsis
French & Saunders: Gentlemen Prefer French & Saunders
French & Saunders: Living in a Material World
French & Saunders: Back with a Vengeance
The Life and Times of Vivienne Vyle
The Vicar of Dibley: 10th Anniversary Specials
A Bit of Fry and Laurie
Law & Order: Trial by Jury: The Complete Series
George Carlin: Jammin' in New York
Dorf Da Bingo King / Dorf and the First Games of Mt. Olympus
Richard Lewis: Concerts from Hell: The Vintage Years
George Carlin: What Am I Doing in New Jersey?
Andy Kaufman: I'm from Hollywood/My Breakfast with Blassie
Brother Sam: A Tribute to Sam Kinison
Andrew Dice Clay: One Night with Dice
Jamie Foxx: Straight from the Foxxhole

link.synopsis: While researching a cure for the common cold, Dr. Peter Denwell (Dean Jones) stumbles across a potion that turns him invisible, but nefarious foreign agents catch wind of the discovery and track him down, bent on using it to dominate the globe. Now, Denwell and his trusty sheep dog must use the formula to beat the spies at their own game. Antonio Margheriti directs this action comedy; Ingeborg Schöner co-stars as Denwell's love interest, Irene.
link.title: synopsis
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
Dr. Goldfoot and the Girl Bombs
Elvira's Movie Macabre: Frankenstein's Castle of Freaks
Gods of War: The Giant of Marathon / The Last Glory of Troy
The Life and Times of Judge Roy Bean
The Discreet Charm of the Bourgeoisie

link.synopsis: When lab technician Virgil Gurdies (Mark Scheibmeir) sets out to win back the heart of his ladylove, Angie (Sydney Andrews), he realizes there's only one way to do so -- by creating the most delectable goat cheese the world has ever tasted. This turns out to be no mean feat when a shady German baker, a ghoulish hermit and a petite goat named Artois all have a hand in the matter in this comedy from Cliff and Kyle Bogart.
link.title: synopsis
How to Make Love to a Woman
Le Cirque: A Table in Heaven

link.synopsis: In this tale of art imitating life, a liberal arts college girl is so distracted by the tortured pseudo-romance she's carrying on with a dorm mate that elements of it begin to creep into her screenplay-in-process. A surreal, just-on-the-verge-of-hysteria tone permeates this Ohio-set romantic comedy, which explores the complexities of love and mistakes. Lena Dunham stars and also writes and directs while she, herself, is a coed.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: In this episodic black comedy, co-writer and director Ruben Östlund delves into the many ways group dynamics and peer pressure influence our daily lives and explores the sometimes-tragic consequences that accompany one's need for acceptance. A teenage girl pays a heavy price for being a "party girl," a sanctimonious schoolteacher defies her colleagues' conformity and a mischievous jokester at a reunion learns that some pranks can go too far.
link.title: synopsis
Scenes from a Marriage: Miniseries Version
The Sacrifice / Directed by Andrei Tarkovsky
The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest
The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
The Girl Who Played with Fire

link.synopsis: To get beautiful bulimic Talia (Nina Braddock) in bed with him, incorrigible womanizer Ken (Adam Goldstein) becomes the only male member of her body image support group, which includes a feminist, a lesbian, an advertising executive, a divorcée and a gay rights activist. Co-starring Melanie Case, Valerie Weak, Stefanie Goldstein and Margaret Cho, this offbeat romantic comedy delivers plenty of insensitivity -- and laughs.
link.title: synopsis
By the Will of Genghis Khan

link.synopsis: Lorraine (Melodie Sisk) keeps her life complicated by working as a nurse by day and secretly moonlighting as a dominatrix by night. Meanwhile, her average-looking roommate, Adrian (Maggie Ross), faces an uphill battle trying to become a professional model. Zach Clark writes and directs this original comedy about pleasure and pain that also stars Diana Cherkas, Ray Converse, Leo Goodman and Lydia Hyslop.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee
Dave Barry's Complete Guide to Guys

link.synopsis: Strip poker, keggers and high jinks: That's what summer is made of -- at least for the friends in this film, who are spending their last months together before heading off to make their way in the world. Life-changing decisions play out against a backdrop of mind-altering partying as the 12 characters celebrate life, love, dreams and memories in this sweetly raucous comedy co-starring Carl T. Evans, Elizabeth Schmidt, Vedette Lim and Scott Laska.
link.title: synopsis
Revenge of the Boarding School Dropouts
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down

link.synopsis: Director Peter Bogdanovich pays tribute to the early days of filmmaking with this comedy about a young attorney -- Leo Harrigan (Ryan O'Neal) -- who stumbles into the movie business after meeting a producer. Before long, Harrigan and his band of actors and crew are cranking out one silent picture after another in a sleepy desert town. Burt Reynolds plays Harrigan's crass leading man, and Stella Stevens co-stars as a silent-screen vamp.
link.title: synopsis
Before the Nickelodeon: The Early Cinema of Edwin S. Porter
Edison: The Invention of the Movies
The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes' Smarter Brother
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
The Longshot / They Went That-A-Way & That-A-Way

link.synopsis: After a freak accident takes the life of his father (Hrant Tokhatyan), Hayk (Narek Ghaplanyan) realizes the morgue has mistakenly delivered the wrong body to his family. As Hayk and his friends try to track down the correct corpse, they run into big trouble with psychotic mobsters. Set in Yerevan, Armenia, this unpredictable comedy also stars Khoren Levonyan, David Tovmasyan and Mayranush Grigoryan.
link.title: synopsis
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay

title.regular: Big Story in a Small City
title.short: Big Story in a Small City

link.synopsis: When chronically misunderstood Robert Mutt (Joshua Peace) is kicked out of the suicide ward for not being suicidal enough, he heeds the words of his hero who claims that fulfillment can be found in three things: money, a woman and a sports championship. Pretty soon, Mutt is mixing it up with drug dealers, a transvestite and an air hockey tournament, all while trying to clear up charges that he's a pervert. Simon Ennis directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Assassination of a High School President

link.synopsis: When her brother, Tyrone (Marcello Thedford), lands in jail, exotic dancer Yolanda (Trina McGee) gets frustrated trying to run his struggling beauty salon and decides to sell it. But a last-minute change of heart causes her to renege on the deal. Now, with the help of her dancer friends, Yolanda endeavors to keep the business afloat -- and keep the angry buyer off her back -- in this sexy comedy.
link.title: synopsis
American Pie Presents: The Book of Love
Keepin' the Faith: Lookin' for Mr. Right
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year
I Don't Know How She Does It

link.synopsis: By throwing back at the world the question so often asked him -- Are you Jewish? -- filmmaker Jamie Kastner confronts issues of identity and what it means to be an outsider as he travels to London, Paris, Berlin and Jerusalem for answers. From a chat with conservative pundit Patrick J. Buchanan to a street interview with Arab residents of suburban Paris, Kastner's self-described "black comedy road movie" sheds a new light on identity politics.
link.title: synopsis
Classic Educational Shorts: Vol. 1: How to be a Man
The True Story of Alexander the Great
If God Is Willing and Da Creek Don't Rise
That the World May Know: Faith Lessons on the Promised Land: Crossroads of the World
The Jewish People: A Story of Survival
Jews and Baseball: An American Love Story
Blessed Is the Match: The Life and Death of Hannah Senesh
Artists of the 20th Century: Marc Chagall

link.synopsis: Cash -- or the lack of it -- is the root of all evil in this British comedy about a trio of broke New Age travelers who pinch an antique dealer's prize pooches in hopes of claiming a gigantic ransom. With the crooks turning on one another and the good guy running into problems of his own -- including a fiery wife, a take-the-law-into-his-own-hands son and a gang of angry loan sharks -- nothing goes as planned in this Jim Doyle-helmed caper flick.
link.title: synopsis
Alfred Hitchcock: Blackmail and Easy Virtue
Tristram Shandy: A Cock and Bull Story
Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason

link.synopsis: Monty Miranda makes his directorial debut with this indie comedy about a young writer (Spencer Berger, who also co-wrote the screenplay) who abandons his craft in favor of a life of crime, only to discover that it might be his true calling. Brian D. Phelan and Gabriel Tigerman co-star as the loyal friends who support his new endeavor, with Kerry Knuppe playing the role of a pretty bank teller who proves to be a distraction.
link.title: synopsis
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
A Wink and a Smile: The Art of Burlesque

link.synopsis: An annual jaunt to Baja California turns into one long, strange trip for five friends who head there to surf but make the costly mistake of hanging with a tagalong dot-commer who gets them in trouble with the Mexican police. Things only get worse when they get stranded in the middle of nowhere … and a burro digests their distributor cap. Rini Bell, Kansas Carradine, Kenny Morrison and Tom Carver co-star in this quirky south-of-the-border comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Inside Sportfishing: Baja 2: Sea of Dreams
Wait Till Your Father Gets Home: Season 1
With a Song in My Heart
The Perfect Age of Rock 'n' Roll

link.synopsis: Director McKay Daines's quixotic comedy about discovering what matters most in life finds the boozy and much-hyped actress Sierra Young (Torrey DeVitto) spinning out of control -- until an intervention lands her in the Wasatch Mountains of Utah at a rehab center. When the program's rigidity sends Sierra running, she hides in a quaint town of quirky locals, including Yale-educated thespian Tyler (K.C. Clyde).
link.title: synopsis
The Prize Winner of Defiance, Ohio
Win a Date with Tad Hamilton!
The Cutting Edge: Going for the Gold

link.synopsis: John Barker directs this engaging comedy about three stand-up comedians who hit the open road to Oppikoppi, South Africa's renowned rock music festival, where they hope to catch their break into the big time. But their dreams are put on hold as acute stage fright, bizarre hangers-on and the temptations of excessive revelry teach them a thing or two about who they really are. Kagiso Lediga, Joey Yusuf Rasdien and David Kibuuka star.
link.title: synopsis
Russell Simmons Presents: Brave New Voices: Season 1
Bab'Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul

link.synopsis: Hoping to locate some dope for a big party they have in the works, Jimmy (Todd Bridges) and his pals turn to their charming supplier, Barney Bumble (Chris Angelo), for help, only to have him get framed and busted for selling pot. Now, Jimmy and company are out to get revenge on the dealer (Jimmy Bridges) who set Barney up -- and still make it to the party on time. Ed and Jose Quiroz direct this stoner comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 2
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
Ryan and Sean's Not So Excellent Adventure
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day

title.regular: I Got Five on It Too
title.short: I Got Five on It Too

link.synopsis: When an unidentified man lands in the hospital with burns all over his body, the police try to determine exactly who he is. His profile matches several missing person reports, which attracts the notice of a wide variety of visitors -- mostly enemies. A complicated tale about fear and hatred that mixes comedy and drama, director Bradley Wigor's feature film debut stars Adam LeFevre, John Speredakos, Peter Friedman and Jessica Almasy.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Director Andrea Meyerson returns for another installment of out-of-the-closet hilarity and high jinks, this time around showcasing a collection of young, up-and-coming comics who have recently stormed onto the gay and lesbian comedy circuit. Returning to her winning combination of laugh-out-loud performances and refreshingly candid interviews, Meyerson introduces viewers to comedians such as Edison Apple, Ryan Hill and Daniel Leary.
link.title: synopsis
Vickie Shaw: You Can Take the Girl Outta Texas...
Suzanne Westenhoefer: Live at the Village
Karen Williams: I Need a Snack
She Likes Girls 4: Tomboys & Tough Girls
Leslie Jordan: My Trip Down the Pink Carpet: Live in Atlanta
Outlaugh: The Best of Queer Comedy
Jason Stuart: Making It to the Middle
Suzanne Westenhoefer: A Bottom on Top
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
I'm the One That I Want

link.synopsis: In the midst of a midlife crisis, Alejandro meets a beautiful woman who draws him into a seedy world of drugs, sex and violence. And then he meets her boyfriend -- a professional killer who knows exactly what he's doing. He feels like he's in the wrong story, but maybe now this &NFi;is&NFi_; his story. Jean Paul Leroux, Jessika Grau and Jesus Cervo co-star in this fast-paced foreign-language comedy from director Carlos Malave.
link.title: synopsis
Vidas Privadas / Pantaleon Y Las Visitadores
Ringside: The Best of Mike Tyson
Donde Quedo La Abuela? El Viaje De La Nonna
Dios los Junta y Ellos Se Separan
Mi Mujer es La Que Manda

link.synopsis: Eager to escape their morbid morgue jobs, slackers Motown (DeRay Davis) and Darius (Jasper Redd) plan to win the big three-on-three basketball tournament and take home its $25,000 cash prize. When their pal (Charles Q. Murphy) brings to life a tall corpse (Bob Sapp), they chance upon a wild idea. If they can teach the zombie to shoot hoops, they'll be unbeatable on the court -- right? Blaxwell Smart directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Big Black Comedy Show: Vol. 1
Shaq & Cedric the Entertainer Present: All Star Comedy Jam
Return of the Living Dead 4: Necropolis
Edgar Allan Poe's The Pit and the Pendulum
Philosophy of a Knife: Limited Edition

link.synopsis: Despite his cynicism over the legitimacy of Mr. Bogus's love-inducing eye drops, ophthalmologist Dr. Pundalik knows something's amiss when, after using the solution, he finds himself falling for his rival, Dr. Purva Purandare. Loosely based on the classic William Shakespeare romantic comedy "A Midsummer Night's Dream," this lighthearted tale from director Mangesh Kadam stars Prashant Damle, Satish Tare, Manisha Joshi and Salakha Pawar.
link.title: synopsis
Kal Ho Naa Ho: Tomorrow May Never Come

link.synopsis: In an effort to honor the family matriarch's dying wish, Urmila (Shilpa Tulaskar) and her husband, Shrikant (Tushar Dalvi), embark on a quest to find a husband for charismatic yet choosey Sai (Sai Tamhankar). But some things are easier said than done. Helmed by director Rajeev Patil, this heartwarming drama -- laced with comedy -- also stars Santosh Juvekar, Subodh Bhave, Sushant Shela, Meghna Erande and Bharti Aacharekar.
link.title: synopsis
Jis Desh Men Ganga Behti Hai

link.synopsis: In the dungeon of an old mansion, scheming Seema (Neelam Mehra) and her bumbling brother, Vikram (Tej Sapru), plot to murder Sunil (Deepak Parashar), the lowborn boyfriend of Seema's niece, Anita (Amita Nangia). But these evildoings are nothing compared to the monstrous spirits lurking in the building. Will Anita and Sunil be reunited, or will a beast kill everyone first in this spine-tingling Bollywood horror comedy?
link.title: synopsis
Run Swinger Run / Sex Club International

link.synopsis: A heavyset Italian woman, Miris (Donatella Rettore), wins a trip to New York City, slims down with a beautiful baroness (Anita Ekberg) she meets and comes back to Italy to get revenge on the boy who tormented her in this zany early-1980s Italian comedy.  With newfound looks and confidence, Miris is set to overcome her previous suicical thoughts and launch a fresh life. Umberto Lenzi directs; Gena Gas, Dario Caporaso and Howard Napper co-star.
link.title: synopsis
5 Dolls for an August Moon / Four Times That Night
1931: Once Upon a Time in New York
The Psycho Lover / Heat of Madness: Double Feature
Inspector Morse 30: The Daughters of Cain
The Virgo, The Taurus and The Capricorn

title.regular: Fatty Girl Goes to New York
title.short: Fatty Girl Goes to New York

link.synopsis: From 1969 to 1971, sexy, soulful Welsh singer Tom Jones heated up television with his top-rated variety show "This Is Tom Jones." In this best-of compilation, Jones welcomes the Bee Gees, John Denver and others for a lineup of groovy entertainment. "Mama" Cass Elliot and Sergio Mendes add to the musical mix, George Carlin and Tim Conway deliver the laughs with their classic comedy, Jones performs his signature hit "What's New Pussycat" and more.
link.title: synopsis
This Is Tom Jones: Legendary Performers
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
Shakira: Live and Off the Record
The Dick Cavett Show: Rock Icons
Music Scene: The Best of 1969-1970: Vol. 2
The Dick Cavett Show: Comic Legends
The Best of Rowan & Martin's Laugh-In 2
The Dick Cavett Show: John & Yoko Collection
The Dick Cavett Show: Hollywood Greats
The Best of the Flip Wilson Show
Tony Orlando & Dawn: The Ultimate Collection
Best of the Jimmy Dean Show: Vol. 1
The Judy Garland Show: Featuring Mel Torme and Diahann Carroll
The Judy Garland Show: Featuring Ray Bolger and Vic Damone
Best of the Jimmy Dean Show: Vol. 2
The Dick Cavett Show: Ray Charles Collection
Barbra Streisand: The Television Specials: Belle of 14th Street
Barbra Streisand: The Television Specials: Barbra Streisand: Happening in Central Park
Barbra Streisand: The Television Specials: Color Me Barbra
Barbra Streisand: The Television Specials: My Name Is Barbra
Barbra Streisand: The Television Specials: Barbra Streisand... and Other Musical Instruments
Judy, Frank and Dean: Once in a Lifetime
The Best of Donny & Marie: Vols. 1 & 2
The Hudson Brothers Razzle Dazzle Show: The Complete Series
The Judy Garland Show: Featuring Tony Bennett and Steve Lawrence

title.regular: This Is Tom Jones: What's New Pussycat
title.short: This Is Tom Jones: What's New Pussycat

link.synopsis: In this zany comedy, Hollywood escort drivers Slimmy (Tim Pingel) and Stewy (Matthew Dowling) solicit the services of hookers Starship (Joy Somers) and Starshyp (Camille Solari) to help make their artistic porn film. But when the novices cast famous porn pros, things go haywire. With the stars making outrageous demands, Slimmy and Stewy may be in over their heads. Kato Kaelin and Seymore Butts star as themselves, and Shay Astar is Apple Martini.
link.title: synopsis
Can You Keep It Up for a Week?
Orgies and the Meaning of Life
The Last House on the Beach
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
How Much Do You Love Me?

link.synopsis: Jason (Nathan Harlan) is catapulted into search mode -- looking for his origins and his family's true history -- when his ultracompetitive brother, Todd (Mark Reeb), divulges a startling secret during a holiday visit home. Writer-director John E. Bryant's comedy about sibling rivalry, "black sheep syndrome" and the value of road trips co-stars Laurel Whitsett, John Jones, Steve Zissis and Cyndi Williams.
link.title: synopsis
Adored: Diary of a Porn Star
Zach Galifianakis: Live at the Purple Onion
How Much Do You Love Me?
Southlander: Diary of a Desperate Musician

link.synopsis: At home, at work and everywhere he goes, Shreerang (Sanjay Narvekar) finds himself surrounded (and dominated) by women. Henpecked and harried, he prays for salvation -- and seemingly receives it when he's given the power to read women's thoughts. But understanding doesn't necessarily equal happiness in this musical comedy directed by Kedar Shinde and co-starring Sonali Bendre, Dilip Prabhavalkar and Rekha Sawant.
link.title: synopsis
Kyo Kii... Main Jhuth Nahin Bolta

link.synopsis: How much turmoil can a 5-year-old boy create in the lives of two households? A lot, it turns out, when that boy -- Chiku -- claims to be the son of the very single and very much in love Yuvraj in this comedy from Kaanchan Adhikkari. With the local constable demanding that Yuvraj take responsibility for the lad and Angela, his girlfriend, leaving, Yuvraj faces pressure from all sides. Vandana Gupte, Makarand Anaspure and Siddharth Jadhav star.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: With his wife living with her grandmother in a far-off village, Prem has a good setup in the big city -- until his boss encounters him with another woman and chaos ensues in this comedy from Radha Swamy. Mistaking the mistress for his spouse, Prem's supervisor invites the "couple" to live with him just when Prem's real wife moves to the city, leaving Prem in over his head. Bharat Jadhav, Ashok Saraf, Kishori Ambiye and Sulabha Deshpande star.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Mumbai newlyweds Sameer and Harshada are still in the honeymoon phase of their relationship when Sameer's childhood friend, Damodar, comes to visit. Despite Damodar's sweet nature, three turns out to be a crowd in this comedy from Kanchan Adhikari. As Damodar and Rashada strike up a friendship, Sameer becomes increasingly jealous, eventually leaving his wife. Now, it's up to the noble-hearted Damodar to make things right.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Family head Dada (Ashok Saraf), who was once terribly jilted by a woman, forbids his brothers and partners to pursue females. So when the guys inevitably set their sights on a pair of lovelies, chaos ensues in this quirky comedy. Will the bitter Dada win out or will love prevail in this film co-starring Makarand Anaspure, Amruta Khanvilkar and Bharat Jadhav? Ankush Choudhary and Sachit Patil co-direct.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When a tiny village finds itself at the mercy of a rampaging wild bull, help arrives in the form of a pair of city officials who plan to catch and kill the crafty creature in this comedy from first-time director Umesh Vinayak Kulkarni. It soon becomes apparent, however, that the villagers are far more interested in the documentary film crew accompanying the officials than they are in capturing the bull. Atul Kulkarni and Mohan Agashe star.
link.title: synopsis
Dashavatar: Every Era Has a Hero

link.synopsis: Filmed live before an audience at the University of North Carolina Wilmington, this song-filled comedy from playwright Donald Gray follows the misadventures of a young woman who allows herself to be sweet-talked by the man of her dreams. But as new details come to light, she discovers that appearances are indeed deceiving. Director Clifton Powell co-stars with a talented cast that includes Vivica A. Fox, Tamika Scott and Angell Conwell.
link.title: synopsis
He Say, She Say, But What Does God Say?
I'm Doing the Right Thing with the Wrong Man
What a Man Wants, What a Woman Needs
For Colored Girls Who Have Considered Suicide
Tyler Perry: What's Done in the Dark
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
Soviet Army Chorus, Band and Dance Ensemble
Blue Man Group: How to Be a Megastar Live!
Rant: Who Says Words with My Mouth
A Prairie Home Collection: Great Moments from the Original Radio Show

title.regular: There's a Stranger in My House
title.short: There's a Stranger in My House

link.synopsis: Six members of fledgling Japanese girl group Oreskaband set their sights on world domination -- but first, they must conquer Hollywood. Enter Donnie Greene (Lucas Grabeel), an upstart who promises to make them famous. Can he figure out how, and does the band have what it takes to make it big in the States? Joan Jett and Brad Dourif co-star in this comedy produced by the same team behind box-office smash High School Musical.
link.title: synopsis
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Behind the Mask: The Rise of Leslie Vernon

link.synopsis: John Voight displays his comedic chops in this loosely scripted comedy (which he co-wrote) about a pair of on-the-run gamblers (Voight, Burt Young) who hightail it to Las Vegas in an attempt to score big and avoid the thugs trying to collect on their gambling debts. At first the plan seems to be working -- with the guys holed up at the MGM Grand Hotel after winning big -- but eventually their past catches up with them. Ann-Margret co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High

link.synopsis: A year after their breakup, Hee-su (Do-yeon Jeon) runs into her smooth-talking ex-boyfriend, Byeong-woon (Jung-woo Ha), and demands he repay the money he owes her. For an entire day, Hee-su follows Byeong-woon around Seoul as he tries to collect cash to make good on his debt. Directed by Yoon-ki Lee, this South Korean romantic comedy features standout performances from its two leading actors.
link.title: synopsis
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2
The Virgin Stripped Bare by Her Bachelors

link.synopsis: After some heavy drinking, Mounir (Lyes Salem) lies to his entire village, saying that his narcoleptic sister, Rym (Sarah Reguieg), is marrying a rich foreigner. When everyone swallows his story wholeheartedly, misguided Mounir must plan a last-minute wedding and find a groom. Full of wonderful surprises, this delightful Algerian comedy also features Mohamed Bouchaïb, Rym Takoucht and Merouane Zmirli.
link.title: synopsis
A Citizen, A Detective & A Thief
Great African Films: Vol. 3: The Desert Ark
Bab'Aziz: The Prince Who Contemplated His Soul

link.synopsis: Humble farmer Maruti (Sanjay Narvekar) goes on the run after he innocently witnesses a politician in an incriminating situation involving mobsters. Newspaper editor Gauri (Nirmiti Sawant) wants Maruti's story fast, but her star reporter, Bharat (Bharat Jadhav), is distracted by a new love. Other, much bigger papers like the Maharashtra Times are hungry for the scoop as well, but Gauri won't give up easy in this fast-paced Marathi comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Once Upon a Time in Mumbai

link.synopsis: When he learns the son he left behind, Vaijhanath (Bharat Jadhav), is visiting London from India, successful businessman Omkar Hanpanwar (Mohan Joshi) decides to feel out his son's true feelings by impersonating a van driver enlisted to transport him to Windsor. When Omkar's identity is eventually revealed, how will it go over? This breezy Marathi comedy features music by Ajit-Hrishikesh and lyrics by Macchindra More.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Supriya (Supriya Pilgaonkar) must persuade her husband, Sachin (Sachin), to make good on his parents' pledge to have Sachin blessed at the Lord Ganesha's Ganpatiphule temple. If they don't make the long journey to the temple, Supriya is convinced they'll continue having problems conceiving a child. Ashok Saraf, Rima Lagu, Nirmiti Sawant, Pradeep Patwardhan, Vijay Patkar and Atul Parchure co-star in this Marathi comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: Spoofing revenge dramas like Kill Bill, this comedy from Norway features Stig Frode Henriksen as amiable country boy Jompa Tormann, who becomes obsessed with retribution after a massacre at his engagement party kills the people he loves. Determined to kill Buljo, the man responsible, Tormann stumbles through a world of bumbling cops and criminals, fighting everyone who tries to thwart his quest for vengeance.
link.title: synopsis
The Work of Director Chris Cunningham
Citizen Toxie: The Toxic Avenger IV
I Know What You Did Last Summer
My Wife Is a Gambling Maestro
The Girl Who Played with Fire
The Butcher, the Chef and the Swordsman

link.synopsis: The second installment in writer-director Ning Ying's Beijing Trilogy, this black comedy follows rookie cop Yang Guoli (Li Zhanho) as he settles into the drudgeries of day-to-day life in a police precinct that's hardly teaming with hardened criminals. Things start to look up when he chases after a rabid dog and busts a petty gambler, and the excitement comes to a head with an intense interrogation of a man accused of insulting a cop.
link.title: synopsis
Who's the Woman, Who's the Man
Love Is a Many Stupid Thing

link.synopsis: While struggling to get his acting career off the ground, former frat boy Kip (Dan Wells) tries to adjust to life in Los Angeles. When he falls for a beautiful Iranian girl (Carolena Sabah), Kip immerses himself in Persian culture to win her love and her family's acceptance. Featuring a fascinating array of quirky characters, this cross-cultural comedy also stars Noah Knight, Dan Janjigian and Janet Davari.
link.title: synopsis
Donald and Dot Clock Found Dead in Their Home
Glow Ropes: The Rise and Fall of a Bar Mitzvah Emcee

link.synopsis: Teenage art student Mirume (Ken'ichi Matsuyama) begins an affair with Yuri (Hiromi Nagasaku), a free-spirited teacher 20 years older than him. But as Mirume develops strong feelings for Yuri, she starts to pull away and retreat into her own secret life. Based on a novel by Naocola Yamazaki, this Japanese movie fuses comedy and drama to reveal amusing insights about love, sex and complex relationships.
link.title: synopsis
Death Note: L: Change the WorLd
Requiem for a Bodyguard: Vol. 4: Gun Crazy
The Last Days of the World
When the Last Sword Is Drawn

link.synopsis: While working at his tiny store, miserly shopkeeper Arkwright (Ronnie Barker) spends most of his time harassing his nephew and employee Granville (David Jason), devising new ways to sell overstocked goods and trying to impress the lovely Nurse Gladys (Lynda Baron). Perpetually indecisive customer Mavis (Maggie Ollerenshaw) and persnickety Mrs. Blewett (Kathy Staff) add to Arkwright's aggravation in this British comedy series.
link.title: synopsis
Open All Hours: The Complete Series: Disc 1
Open All Hours: The Complete Series: Disc 2
Open All Hours: The Complete Series: Disc 3
Open All Hours: The Complete Series: Disc 4
Steptoe and Son / Steptoe and Son Ride Again
The Fall and Rise of Reginald Perrin: The Complete Series
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Eddie Murphy
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
Saturday Night Live: The Best of Saturday TV Funhouse
The Funny Blokes of British Comedy
South Park: The Passion of the Jew
The Worst Week of My Life
Futurama the Movie: Bender's Big Score

title.regular: Open All Hours: The Complete Series
title.short: Open All Hours: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: After getting stoned with a school pothead (Sean Marquette) for the first time, a high school valedictorian (Matt Bush) unexpectedly faces a drug test that threatens his scholarship. Now the two concoct a scheme to get the entire student body high so everyone will fail. Co-stars in this indie comedy include Colin Hanks, Yeardley Smith, Adrien Brody as a drug dealer and Michael Chiklis as the school principle.
link.title: synopsis
The Dangerous Lives of Altar Boys

link.synopsis: Ageless guardian angel Will (Julian Rhind-Tutt) has watched over the beautiful Amanda (Kelly Reilly) for years. But when he's reassigned to guard another mortal, Will realizes he's broken a big rule of his profession: He's fallen in love. So while the big boss is looking the other way, Will steals away to Puerto Rico to win Amanda from her handsome new boyfriend in this heavenly romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
Judy Ann & Ryan 2-in-1: Rosaryo / Inday Bote

link.synopsis: Running low-level errands for a petty-crime ring, young David (Petur Johann Sigfusson) sees his status rise when he claims to be tight with an underworld kingpin. Trouble is, this mysterious don is in fact David's delusional landlord, Harald (Eggert Thorleifsson), who fancies himself a mafioso. Now, if David hopes to hang on to his newfound respect, he'll have to make sure Harald doesn't regain his marbles in this comedy from Iceland.
link.title: synopsis
Never Sleep Again: The Elm Street Legacy
Pusher 3: I'm the Angel of Death
Pusher 2: With Blood on My Hands
How to Be a Serial Killer

link.synopsis: Faced with two very different sons -- noisy, hotheaded Appu and mute, saintly Achchu -- Ravunni decides to raise his boys in two very different places. Appu grows up tough in Pollachi, while Achchu becomes a performer in his dad's troupe in Palakkad. A lifelong rivalry between the twins -- both played by superstar funnyman Mammootty -- soon comes to a head in this fast-paced Malayalam comedy, which also stars Gopika and Lakshmi Rai.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Though his film career faded long ago, Karan "KK" Kumar (Om Puri) still carries himself like the top Bollywood star he once was -- that is, until a visiting documentary filmmaker (Sophie Dahl) exposes the insecurities lurking beneath KK's confident surface. Now it's up to KK to turn his energies toward his son, a young actor who could possibly carry on the family acting tradition. Indian screen veteran Puri shines in this Bollywood comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year
Schoolgirl Report: Vol. 6: What Parents Would Gladly Hush Up

link.synopsis: Hosts Mike Nelson, Kevin Murphy and Bill Corbett -- formerly of "Mystery Science Theater 3000" -- take aim at B-movie legend Roger Corman's infamous black comedy about a down-and-out flower-shop employee (Jonathan Haze) who accidentally grows a man-eating plant. Shot over the course of two days and one night, Corman's 1960 cult classic features Jack Nicholson playing a loopy masochist in one of his first big-screen performances.
link.title: synopsis
RiffTrax: Night of the Living Dead
RiffTrax: Plan 9 from Outer Space: LIVE! Nashville 2009
Film Crew: Wild Women of Wongo
The Film Crew: Killers from Space
RiffTrax: The Best of RiffTrax Shorts: Vol. 2
RiffTrax: The Best of RiffTrax Shorts: Vol. 1
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Blood Waters of Dr. Z
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Final Sacrifice
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Boggy Creek II: And the Legend Continues
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Merlin's Shop of Mystical Wonders
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Touch of Satan
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Crawling Eye
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Overdrawn at the Memory Bank

title.regular: RiffTrax: The Little Shop of Horrors
title.short: RiffTrax: The Little Shop of Horrors

link.synopsis: In a perfect marriage of commentator and subject, "Mystery Science Theater 3000" hosts Mike Nelson, Bill Corbett and Kevin Murphy pull out all the stops as they skewer this offbeat musical comedy that features the legendary Three Stooges. While waiting tables at a hip nightclub, Curly, Larry and Moe lend a hand to pair of star-crossed lovers, played by Gale Storm and Phil Regan. The Tympany Five, led by Louis Jordan, provides music.
link.title: synopsis
The Film Crew: Killers from Space
Film Crew: Wild Women of Wongo
RiffTrax: The Best of RiffTrax Shorts: Vol. 1
RiffTrax: The Little Shop of Horrors
RiffTrax: Plan 9 from Outer Space: LIVE! Nashville 2009
RiffTrax: Night of the Living Dead
RiffTrax: The Best of RiffTrax Shorts: Vol. 2
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Blood Waters of Dr. Z
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Final Sacrifice
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Boggy Creek II: And the Legend Continues
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Merlin's Shop of Mystical Wonders
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Touch of Satan
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Crawling Eye
Mystery Science Theater 3000: Overdrawn at the Memory Bank
Mystery Science Theater 3000: The Girl in Gold Boots

link.synopsis: When he discovers that his health insurance won't cover the steep medical expenses for his seriously ill daughter, otherwise law-abiding Xavier and his bumbling friends scheme to raise the cash by robbing a neighborhood drug dealer. Little do they know that another crew of would-be crooks also plans to rob the same dealer on the same day. Tyrone Burton, Countrified Wedman, Danny Strong and Cocoa Brown star in this caper comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Rudy Ray Moore: Live at Wetlands: N.Y.C.
Steve Miller Band: Live from Chicago
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: Tired of meeting the wrong women, Matt (Justin Kane) visits Colombia, where the quirky dating service Agencia del Amor introduces him to the beautiful Rebecca (Ana Lucia Dominguez). It's love at first sight for the intercontinental couple, despite their many cultural issues. Soon, they're talking marriage while their families complain loudly about their language barriers and religious differences. Love speaks all tongues in this romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
El Lado Oscuro del Corazon II
The Dark Side of the Heart

link.synopsis: Stuck in a sleepy island town, rookie cop Leonidas (Aris Servetalis) yearns to work big-time cases in the city. When the town drunk is found dead, the novice finally gets his chance to prove his mettle in this romantic comedy filmed in the Greek isles. The investigation introduces Leonidas to Angeliki (Vicky Papadopoulou), an alluring hometown heroine who made it big as television host -- and may be involved in the wino's demise.
link.title: synopsis
From the Edge of the City
A Woman, a Gun and a Noodle Shop
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single
Vermilion Pleasure Night: Vol. 1: Optic Erotica

link.synopsis: Life, love and relationships -- explored from a Christian point of view -- are at the crux of this romantic comedy about a young man and woman trying to get it right the second time around after failing to make it as a couple during college. Struggling to learn from past mistakes and take what lessons they can from the couples around them, Eve (Kelly Hoelscher) and Thad (Josh Murray) come to realize that trust is paramount on the rocky road of love.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Belle and the Beast: A Christian Romance
The Work and the Glory III: A House Divided

link.synopsis: When Tommy (Grant Barker) discovers that his mule, Jackie-A, can talk, he hopes the beast can help him save the family farm from financial ruin -- and save his widowed mother from the romantic attentions of a crafty real estate agent. But with neighborhood bullies constantly scheming against them, can Tommy and Jackie-A win the big riding competition that will set them all free? Andrew Stevens directs this family comedy; Kevin Sorbo co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
Labou and the Quest for the Lost Treasure
William Wegman: The Hardly Boys in Hardly Gold
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
The Prince and the Pauper: Double Trouble
The Jungle Book: Rikki-Tikki-Tavi to the Rescue
Stuart Little 3: Call of the Wild

link.synopsis: Hit hard by the Great Depression, struggling businessman Edmund Gilbert (Edmund Gwenn) collaborates with his beautiful daughter Lilian (Wendy Barrie) on a get-rich scheme centered around swindling greedy investors. While prepping their elaborate plan, Edmund and Lilian recruit hapless electrician Paul Martin (Robert Donat) to take part in their ruse. Morris Harvey and Lawrence Grossmith also star in this lighthearted comedy from Zoltan Korda.
link.title: synopsis
Massacre / Three Desperate Men / Outlaw Women
You'll Find Out / Zombies on Broadway
My Sister Eileen / She Wouldn't Say Yes
The Invisible Agent / The Invisible Man's Revenge
Hollywood: An Empire of Their Own
Milky Way / Kid Dynamite: Double Feature

link.synopsis: With the tide turning in favor of the Allied Forces, leaders of the Third Reich hope that a rousing speech from Hitler (Helge Schneider) can spark a resurgence of confidence for the German people. One problem: The Führer's too depressed to deliver. The solution: a little coaching from Goebbels's (Sylvester Groth) former acting teacher, a Jew by the name of Adolf Grunbaum (Ulrich Mühe). Adriana Altaras also stars in this wry comedy from Dani Levy.
link.title: synopsis
Harlan: In the Shadow of Jew Süss
Nazi Medicine / The Cross and the Star: Double Feature

link.synopsis: This film takes you deep into the annual Gathering of the Juggalos, a four-day festival of music, comedy, wrestling, thrill rides and more attended by the intensely devoted fans of hardcore hip-hop group Insane Clown Posse. Rap legend Ice-T narrates this descent into madness as fans celebrate their common bond amid the band's Dark Carnival mythos and get crazy with live performances by Twiztid, Three 6 Mafia, 2 Live Crew and others.
link.title: synopsis
Insane Clown Posse: Hatchet Attacks: Live From Red Rocks
Insane Clown Posse: Juggalo Championsh*t Wrestling: Vol. 1
Three 6 Mafia: The Ultimate Video Collection
C-Walk: It's a Way of Livin'
Three 6 Mafia: Kingz of Memphis Unauthorized
Ice-T and SMG: The Repossession Live
The Adventures of Street Dogg: Vol. 2
South Beach Sounds: Miami Music Week: Vol. 1
Loudes 68: The Movement of Hip-Hop and Reggaeton
Mister D: From Southland to Japan
Wu-Tang Clan: Legend of the Wu-Tang: The Videos
The Adventures of Street Dogg: Vol. 1
The Coup: The Best Coup DVD Ever
Public Enemy: It Takes a Nation: London Invasion 1987
Hustle Up DVD Magazine: Vol. 2: Hip-Hop
All Access DVD Magazine: The Remix: Vol. 1
Eminem: Live from New York City
Bad Boy Bill: Behind the Decks

title.regular: Insane Clown Posse: A Family Underground
title.short: Insane Clown Posse: A Family Underground

link.synopsis: While reuniting with the rest of their family in their childhood home, Bobby (Alex Hinsky) and his older brother (Marc Thompson) come to blows over the subject of their parents' will and the fact that Bobby doesn't seem to know who he is -- or what he wants out of life. Chris Staron writes and directs this feature-length comedy with an evangelical Christian message about family, faith and a troubled teen's search for spiritual identity.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Belle and the Beast: A Christian Romance
The Work and the Glory III: A House Divided
People Who Met Jesus: Series II

link.synopsis: Caught between two worlds (one ancient and one modern) and two cultures (the Qiang and Han ethnic groups), lovely Yina Erma finds her life filled with chaos and intrigue as her wedding day approaches in this romantic comedy. Filmed in an area of China's Sichuan province that was later largely destroyed by an earthquake, the movie chronicles the battle between families about whether the nuptials should take place in the country or the city.
link.title: synopsis
Jackie Chan: The Kung Fu Years / Force 5 / The Power of Aikido / Dr. Wai
Balzac and the Little Chinese Seamstress
If You Are the One: Love and Marriage

link.synopsis: Flailing after the sudden death of his father, Whitney (Bryan Fisher) clings even tighter to his girlfriend of four years, Taylor (Tiffany Dupont), who is less invested in their relationship and also happens to be exploring her sexuality. While seeking advice from his best pal, Aldo (Will Stiles) -- who's also in love with Taylor -- Whitney fights to keep hold of his girlfriend, his job and his mind in this breezy and heartfelt romantic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
How to Go Out on a Date in Queens

link.synopsis: Jiro (Keisuke Koide) usually spends his birthday alone, but this year, he gets the gift of a lifetime when a goofy but beautiful girl (Haruka Ayase) celebrates the occasion with him -- only to vanish mysteriously at the end of the night. A year later, she returns with bizarre news: She's a cyborg from the future who's been sent to protect him. Writer-director Jae-young Kwak blends sci-fi with romantic comedy in this unique Japanese charmer.
link.title: synopsis
The Last Days of the World
Requiem for a Bodyguard: Vol. 4: Gun Crazy
When the Last Sword Is Drawn
Warm Water Under a Red Bridge
Genghis Khan: To the Ends of the Earth and Sea

link.synopsis: A quartet of arrogant Calcutta bachelors (Soumitra Chatterjee, Subhendu Chatterjee, Samit Bhanja and Robi Ghosh) vacationing in a forest village plan to relax, get drunk and forget the city. But when they meet two local women, the urbanite friends soon learn they're not so sophisticated after all. Legendary filmmaker Satyajit Ray directs this class-conscious comedy that co-stars Sharmila Tagore and Kaberi Bose as the clever village women.
link.title: synopsis
Jis Desh Men Ganga Behti Hai

link.synopsis: Ad agency CEO Sandip Kapoor (Manoj Bajpai) scrambles to save his business when authorities suddenly close his office. Setting up shop in a makeshift workplace, he and a friend (Vijay Raaz) try every trick in the book to argue, coax or bribe officials into changing their minds. Based on producer Kapoor's real-life experience with a controversial government campaign to close businesses deemed illegal, this Indian comedy was directed by Anand Kumar.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year

link.synopsis: This family comedy from India explores the music industry and the people trying to make a name for themselves in the business -- whether they're driven by fame and fortune or by the want to show off their real talent and love for singing. Dilawar Sidhu directs and appears in the film, which stars Sarwinder Kaur, Gagan Gill, Gurdeep Kakrala, Suleman Bhatt, Raj Virk, Gurchet Chitrakar, Prakash Gadhu and Gurdeep Kakrala.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: A father and daughter who share a close relationship want to make each other happy -- and both believe this bliss will be achieved by helping the other find the best-suited partner for marriage in this comedy from India. But they discover their goals for each other are not as trouble-free to achieve as they had hoped. Directed by Raju Joshi, the film stars Devyani Thakkar, Leena Shah, Rajiv Mehta, Charul Bhavsar and Nilesh Joshi.
link.title: synopsis
Som Thi Shukra Taro, Shaniware Hun Maro
Pachhi Kehta Nahi Ke Kahyun Nahotu

link.synopsis: Eagerly anticipating their first night of unrestrained passion, newlyweds Jenny (Hayley Mills) and Arthur (Hywel Bennett) must postpone their conjugal bliss when they fall prey to practical jokes, thwarted honeymoon plans and other misadventures. The frustrated couple's attempts to consummate their love are again challenged when they must temporarily take up residence with Arthur's intrusive parents. Roy Boulting directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
There's a Girl in My Soup
Can You Keep It Up for a Week?
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Prime of Miss Jean Brodie
High School Big Shot / High School Caesar / Date Bait
Five on the Black Hand Side

link.synopsis: After a mysterious God-like cowboy warns him of an impending apocalypse, psych patient Lionel (Christian Campbell) sets out to write a new set of latter-day commandments to help humanity divert the catastrophe. But as his journey unfolds, he and fellow inmate Tin (director Russell Friedenberg) run up against shifting realities, their own dark past and a hospital staffer with a savior complex. Heather Rae co-stars in this mind-bending comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
The Glamorous Life of Sachiko Hanai
S. Darko: A Donnie Darko Tale

link.synopsis: If you think there are limits to human stupidity, think again: The first season of this reality TV comedy show proves otherwise, spotlighting the weird and wacky predicaments that folks (and animals) get themselves into. From topless women to crazy car wrecks, public urination, bumbling burglars, animals gone berserk and more, the show revels in the foibles of everyday life through practical jokes and all manner of faux pas captured on film.
link.title: synopsis
The Serial Killers: The Sick Minds Behind the Most Gruesome Murders in America
The First 48: The Most Intense Investigations
Survivor: Season 1: The Greatest and Most Outrageous Moments
Blind Date: Dates From Hell Uncensored
The Best of Ground Force: Garden Rescues
Changing Rooms: Trust Me, I'm a Designer
Inside the Actors Studio: Barbra Streisand
Viva La Bam: Season 1: Bonus Material
Taxicab Confessions: New York, New York
Britney and Kevin: Chaotic: The DVD
America's Funniest Home Videos: The Best of Kids & Animals
Ruby: A Journey to Lose the First 100 Lbs.

link.synopsis: Follow the evolution of Monty Python from its beginnings as a wacky British sketch comedy troupe to its current standing as a certified global phenomenon that redefined humor and shaped an entire generation of American comics. Judd Apatow, Hank Azaria, David Hyde Pierce and other performers share their favorite Python moments and explain how the group influenced their work and inspired them to push the boundaries of entertainment.
link.title: synopsis
Monty Python's And Now for Something Completely Different
Monty Python's The Meaning of Life
Monty Python and the Holy Grail
Monty Python's Flying Circus: John Cleese's Personal Best
Monty Python's Flying Circus: Eric Idle's Personal Best
This Is What Democracy Looks Like
Smothers Brothers Comedy Hour: The Best of Season 2
The Thin Blue Line: The Complete Lineup
Extras: The Extra Special Series Finale
The League of Gentlemen: Christmas Special
Knowing Me Knowing You with Alan Partridge: The Complete Series
John Cleese on How to Irritate People
The Best of So Graham Norton
Futurama: Into the Wild Green Yonder

link.synopsis: When socially awkward salesman George Bird (Alec Guinness) discovers he only has a few months to live, he cashes in his life savings for one more hurrah at a seaside resort, where he learns as much about himself as he does about the resort's staff and guests. This darkly comic British drama, which co-stars Beatrice Campbell as Bird's love interest, Sheila, inspired the 2006 Queen Latifah comedy by the same name.
link.title: synopsis
The Doctor Takes a Wife / A Night to Remember
Love and Pain and the Whole Damn Thing
Heroes for Sale / Wild Boys of the Road
The Bridge on the River Kwai
The Man in the White Suit

link.synopsis: Get your funny with a side of fabulous in this comedy extravaganza from New York City that features gay comics such as Hedda Lettuce, Frank DeCaro, Jaffee Cohen and Judy Gold dishing up the goods. Hosted by Caroline Rhea, this edition also stars veteran comedians Jenette Sampson, Michele Balan, Rick Crom, Poppi Kramer and Jackie Hoffman, along with hot young breakout comics Jason Scarlatti, Michael Brill and more.

link.synopsis: Erik Rivera -- a former comedic correspondent for "The Montel Williams Show" -- hosts this showcase of Latino funnymen (and women) that delivers comedy club-style laughs without stiffing you with a two-drink minimum. Featured personalities in this second edition of the Muy Caliente series include established comics such as Chris Mata, Cristela Alonzo, Mark DeMayo, Joe Rocha and Sara Contreras as well as breakout stars like Christina Galston.

link.synopsis: Union leader Antoine (Jacques Villeret) realizes that satisfying both the needs of his workers and the demands of his company takes much more work than he anticipated in this French comedy. First, he gets the workers to agree to a strike if their failing factory starts forcing layoffs. But when he and his wife (Anne Roumanoff) win the lottery, Antoine decides to buy the company. From there, never-ending, hilarious complications arise.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Smartly blending slapstick and sarcasm, this MTV sketch comedy show features hysterical skits populated by off-the-wall characters like catchphrase-dropping Louie, angry teenager Doug and former Hollywood agent James Dixon. "State" cast members such as Michael Ian Black, Michael Showalter, David Wain,  Ben Garant and Kerri Kenney have collaborated on subsequent projects, including "Stella," "Reno 911!" and "Wet Hot American Summer."

link.synopsis: Acting instructor Sergio might be taking his duties a bit too seriously as he leads child actors through an intense workshop, pushing his young protégés to perfect their craft before they have even exited puberty. This droll comedy from Argentine director Martin Rejtman focuses on a rarely seen side of the entertainment industry, revealing a world where young would-be stars face intense scrutiny from an overly demanding teacher.
link.title: synopsis
No Dejare Que No Me Quieras
I Don't Know What Your Eyes Have Done to Me

link.synopsis: Angela (Elisabeth Röhm), a morally bankrupt acting coach, helps slimy criminals avoid prison by training them how to appear innocent in court. But when a former client pegs her as his next murder victim, Angela starts running scared and realizes her past mistakes. Written and directed by Colleen Patrick, this screwball comedy also stars Eric Roberts, Sean Patrick Flanery, Jim Holmes and Rick Overton.
link.title: synopsis
Miss Cast Away and the Island Girls
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: Convinced that a stint in an insane asylum is the antidote to their anxieties and frustrations, six strangers aim to commit themselves to a deluxe mental hospital, only to discover that the exclusive institution only has room for one. With the chance of escape hanging in the balance, each wannabe patient pulls out all the stops to prove that he or she is most in need of "treatment" in this demented indie comedy from director Rania Ajami.
link.title: synopsis
My Son, My Son, What Have Ye Done
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
The Inner Life of Martin Frost

link.synopsis: To prevent his town's Revolutionary War battlefield from becoming the site of a new Indian casino, dedicated history buff Chase (Justin Long) teams up with sexy troublemaker Lucy (Emmanuelle Chriqui) to attack the lucrative venture's biggest champion, crooked Mayor Fishback (Rob Corddry). Throughout this charming comedy, Chase struggles to convince the locals that legalized gambling is the wrong solution to their city's financial woes.
link.title: synopsis
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail

link.synopsis: Nothing can tear friends John (Aashish Choudhary), Sidh (Arshad Warsi) and Amit (Yash Tonk) apart -- or so they think. The beautiful Sheetal (Udita Goswami) has swept John off his feet, meaning he has less time for his buddies. When Sidh and Amit warn John that she only wants him for his money, he scoffs. Will their mission to rescue him from a gold digger succeed, or is John too blinded by love? Aarti Chhabria co-stars in this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Rocket Singh: Salesman of the Year
